photo.alt:
Trigger warning: miscarriage

For the past four days I‚Äôve been bleeding, because my body is giving birth to a baby I‚Äôll never get to hold.

I always wanted to be a mother so I was ecstatic (and terrified) to find out we were expecting a baby. We picked out names, researched strollers, and told our closest friends and family. We were thrilled.

But as I sit here, writing this post at ten weeks pregnant, I am having a miscarriage.

After two hospital visits and a very painful blood draw, the doctors simply said ‚Äúthis is very common and there‚Äôs nothing we can do.‚Äù And while they‚Äôre right, that doesn‚Äôt make it any less painful.

I have never been in this much physical pain in my entire life. It‚Äôs been several days of extensive bleeding and the only thing that helps is crying/screaming. Pain medication doesn‚Äôt help. I‚Äôve almost passed out from the immense pain. I am not okay. I won‚Äôt be okay for a while. But I‚Äôll get there, slowly.

This is the most raw post I‚Äôll ever make but I felt it was important. Many women and couples endure miscarriages in silence, feeling lonely and sometimes ashamed. If you have had a miscarriage I want you to know that you are not alone and you did nothing wrong.

Thank you for your support.
